this series just never could get their big break three solidif janky titles that moved back and forth in terms of quality and problems but showed consistent effort to improve and then on the day of their biggest game so fars launch the dev got shitcanned not really a huge surprise seeing as conquistadors was crowdfunded and vikings by their own admission did not do as well as they had expected but i figured theyd have at least given their third game time to fail before axing them

xcom with racist nuns it can be a little technically jank at times and the departures from historical realism where the spanish empire appears to be more gender egalitarian than any modern society are a bitconfusing to say the least but if you can suspend your disbelief a little bit and let yourself care about the characters its a game thats genuinely emotionally affecting and tactically fraught

absolutely amazing game such a hidden gem with a unique setting  the combat is simple but good and still engaging with very tense moments the best part surely is how the game make you feel like a conquistador unique characters indigenous politics and rewarding exploration companions will very rarely say something but with the camping action it is done in a way that you feel like youre talking with a fellow companion in arms
a true gem and the start of a great game series

this game was and is one of my favorite turn based strategy games the art music and story of this game make it intensely immersive and the combat is very satisfying this game combines turn based strategy with exploration and management to make a very well rounded and unique game

the game tells a story of a historical period that did not receive much attention before so its a plus from me gameplay is a bit clunky at some times but i overlooked it especially due to the story and detailed construction and feel of the period some classes are also unbalanced for example hunter is close to useless and i dont like what they did with scholar as well on the other hand some indian native classes is very op  overall its a good game

a storytelling gem it has an awesome setting an interesting story and a lot of cool decisions and things to discover  by modern standards the gameplay is maybe a little bit unusual for nonstrategy players but i find it still very intuitive and easy to learn it is definetly worth checking out and something that gives you a feeling of adventure and thirst for exploring

my crew was as carefully chosen as the disciplines of christ and i still get thrashed by mountain raiders on my way to an optional quest its fun to see how far weve come between 2013 to 2022 with expeditions rome

the expeditions series started off relatively small but the game shows the potential of the series the combat is almost there the writing is decent and has some surprises the colonization element is handled well and there are plenty of choices to make the random encounters are badly balanced but the camp mechanics is very fun especially once you upgrade some followers remember to make as many cannonballs as possible also try to find all the map markers

very good and relaxing game  i prefer this one other expeditionsviking in viking you have too much micromanagment with you companions like who do i need to lvl up for a cook etc long loadtimes and resourcespicking is annoying not here this one shows hows done right  its fun to explore the map and pick up the resources fights are tactical and fun and the music and atmosphere are very satisfying  its a game where you can dive deep in relax and forget the time
a very good tactical rpg for its time buy it on sale
